Mr Vance, I pray that your daughter is fortunate enough to bear children of her own one day. I hope she will not need to turn to IVF as a second option,\" she wrote. \"Because you are trying to take that away from her, too.\"\n\nVance made the \"cat lady\" comments during a 2021 Fox News interview, where he questioned Vice President Kamala Harris' leadership capabilities because she does not have biological children.\n\nVance said in the interview that the country was run by a \"bunch of childless cat ladies with miserable lives\" who are \"making the country miserable too\".\n\nHe added: \"Look at Kamala Harris, Pete Buttigieg, AOC, the entire future of the Democrats is controlled by people without children,\" Vance said. \"How does it make any sense we've turned our country over to people who don't really have a direct stake in it?\"\n\nThe clip has gone viral in the build up to the November presidential election, for which Harris is now running as the Democrat candidate after President Joe Biden stepped down.\n\nAniston, who does not have any children, has been open about her experience with IVF in the past.\n\nIn a 2016 Huffington Post essay, Aniston wrote that women don't need to be \"married or mothers to be complete\".\n\n\"We get to decide for ourselves what is beautiful when it comes to our bodies. Aniston posted a screenshot of a social media post by Ron Filipkowski, editor-in-chief of the MeidasTouch Network, which included a 2021 interview clip of Vance on \"Tucker Carlson Tonight.\"\n\nIn the clip, Filipkowski highlighted Vance's controversial statement: \"JD Vance says women who haven't given birth like Kamala Harris are 'childless cat ladies who are miserable at their own lives,' and have 'no direct stake' in America.\"\n\nAniston expressed her disbelief, writing, \"I truly can't believe this is coming from a potential VP of the United States. All I can say is... Mr. Vance, I pray that your daughter is fortunate enough to bear children of her own one day. I hope she will not need to turn to IVF as a second option. Because you are trying to take that away from her, too.\"\n\nThe original conversation between Vance and Carlson aired on Fox News in July 2021, during Vance's campaign for the U.S. Senate seat in Ohio. In the interview, Vance criticized childless politicians, saying, \"We are effectively run in this country... by a bunch of childless cat ladies who are miserable at their own lives and the choices that they've made, and so they wanna make the rest of the country miserable, too. It's just a basic fact. You look at Kamala Harris, Pete Buttigieg, AOC (Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez), the entire future of the Democrats is controlled by people without children.\"\n\nHe further questioned the logic of having leaders without children, stating, \"And how does it make any sense that we've turned our country over to people who don't really have a direct stake in it?\"\n\nIt's worth noting that Harris has two stepchildren with her husband, Second Gentleman Douglas Emhoff. Vance's daughter after 'childless cat lady' comment", "body": "Jennifer Aniston blasted Donald Trump's vice-presidential candidate, J.D. Vance, for comments declaring Democrats who have not given birth to be \"childless cat ladies.\"\n\nVance, then an Ohio Senate candidate, made the comments in 2021, during a sit-down with Tucker Carlson on his former Fox News Show.\n\n\"We're effectively run in this country -- via the Democrats, via our corporate oligarchs -- by a bunch of childless cat ladies who are miserable at their own lives and the choices that they've made, and so they want to make the rest of the country miserable too,\" Vance told Carlson.\n\n\"You look at Kamala Harris, Pete Buttigieg, AOC: The entire future of the Democrats is controlled by people without children, and how does it make any sense that we've turned our country over to people who don't really have a direct stake in it?\" he added.\n\nHarris, the presumptive Democratic presidential nominee, has two stepchildren with her husband, Doug Emhoff.\n\nAniston caught wind of the resurfaced clip with this week and took aim at Vance with a post on Instagram.\n\n\"I truly can't believe that this is coming from a potential VP of the United States,\" the 55-year-old actress wrote. \"All I can say is... Mr Vance, I pray that your daughter is fortunate enough to bear children of her own one day.\"\n\nShe concluded: \"I hope she will not need to turn to IVF as a second option. Because you are trying to take that away from her, too.\"\n\nVance, who has three children, has been vocal about his opposition to abortion and even fertility treatment.\n\nIn a 2022 interview with Allure, Aniston opened up about her own experiences regarding her struggles with fertility and IVF.\n\n\"It was a challenging road for me, the baby-making road,\" Aniston said, reflecting on her 30s and 40s. \"All the years and years and years of speculation... It was really hard. I was going through IVF, drinking Chinese teas, you name it. I was throwing everything at it.\"\n\nShe added: \"I would've given anything if someone had said to me, 'Freeze your eggs. Do yourself a favor.' You just don't think it. So here I am today. JD Vance over a resurfaced 2021 interview in which he said the United States was being run by \"a bunch of childless cat ladies.\"\n\n\"I truly can't believe this is coming from a potential VP of The United States,\" Aniston wrote Wednesday in an Instagram Story, including a clip of Vance's comments.\n\nThe interview re-gained traction this week after it was posted on X, days after former President Donald Trump announced that the Republican senator from Ohio would be his vice presidential running mate.\n\nDuring a 2021 appearance on Tucker Carlson's former Fox News show, Vance said that the country was being led \"by a bunch of childless cat ladies who are miserable at their own lives and the choices that they've made.\"\n\n\"So they want to make the rest of the country miserable too,\" Vance continued. \"And it's just a basic fact. If you look at Kamala Harris, Pete Buttigieg, AOC, the entire future of the Democrats is controlled by people without children. And how does it make any sense that we've turned our country over to people who don't really have a direct stake in it?\"\n\nHarris is now running for president after President Joe Biden dropped out of the 2024 presidential race.\n\nVance went on to say in the clip that he believes people \"who go home at night and see the face of a smiling kid, whatever their profession, I think they're happier, I think they're healthier, and they're going to be better prepared to actually lead this country.\"\n\nAniston also called out Vance over his far-right stance on reproductive rights.\n\n\"All I can say is... Mr. Vance, I pray that your daughter is fortunate enough to bear children of her own one day,\" Aniston wrote. \"I hope she will not need to turn to IVF as a second option. Because you are trying to take that away from her, too.\"\n\nThe actor told Allure in 2022 that she tried to get pregnant for many years but \"it was a challenging road\" for her.\n\n\"I was going through IVF, drinking Chinese teas, you name it,\" she said. \"I was throwing everything at it. I would've given anything if someone had said to me, 'Freeze your eggs. Do yourself a favor.' You just don't think it. So here I am today. The ship has sailed.\"\n\nAniston, 55, said the constant media scrutiny and false claims that she didn't want children because she was \"selfish\" were hurtful.", "source": {"uri": "nbcnews.com", {"uri": "2024-07-433092740", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-07-25", "time": "09:46:48", "dateTime": "2024-07-25T09:46:48Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-07-25T05:00:01Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.8039215803146362, "url": "https://www.aol.com/jennifer-aniston-hits-back-jd-032510950.html", "title": "Jennifer Aniston hits back at JD Vance's viral 'childless cat ladies' comments", "body": "Jennifer Aniston hits back at JD Vance's viral 'childless cat ladies' comments\n\nKiMi Robinson, USA TODAY\n\nUpdated July 25, 2024 at 7:00 AM\n\nJennifer Aniston is hitting back at comments about politicians who are \"childless cat ladies\" made by Republican vice presidential candidate Sen. JD Vance, which have recently gone viral.\n\n\"The Morning Show\" star, 55, on Wednesday took to her Instagram Stories and posted a screenshot of a social media post in which Ron Filipkowski, editor-in-chief of the MeidasTouch Network, shared a 2021 \"Tucker Carlson Tonight\" interview clip with Vance.\n\n\"JD Vance says women who haven't given birth like Kamala Harris are 'childless cat ladies who are miserable at their own lives,' and have 'no direct stake' in America,\" Filipkowski wrote alongside the 28-second clip.\n\n\"I truly can't believe this is coming from a potential VP of the United States,\" Aniston wrote. \"All I can say is... Mr. Vance, I pray that your daughter is fortunate enough to bear children of her own one day. I hope she will not need to turn to IVF as a second option. Because you are trying to take that away from her, too.\"\n\nWhat did JD Vance say about 'childless cat ladies?'\n\nThe conversation between Vance and Carlson aired on Fox News in July 2021, when Vance was running for Ohio's U.S. Senate seat.\n\n\"We are effectively run in this country ... by a bunch of childless cat ladies who are miserable at their own lives and the choices that they've made, and so they wanna make the rest of the country miserable, too,\" Vance told Carlson. \"It's just a basic fact. You look at Kamala Harris, Pete Buttigieg, AOC (Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez), the entire future of the Democrats is controlled by people without children.\"\n\nHe added, \"And how does it make any sense that we've turned our country over to people who don't really have a direct stake in it?\"\n\nHarris has two stepchildren with her husband, Second Gentleman Douglas Emhoff. Transportation Secretary Buttigieg and husband Chasten welcomed twins weeks after Vance's interview.\n\n'He was happy' Jennifer Aniston recalls last conversation with Matthew Perry\n\nJennifer Aniston said fertility struggles were a 'challenging road'\n\nIn 2022, the \"Friends\" star opened up about her fertility struggles for the first time in a cover story for Allure.\n\n\"I was trying to get pregnant,\" she said, referring to when she was in her late 30s into her 40s. \"It was a challenging road for me, the baby-making road.\"\n\n\"All the years and years and years of speculation... It was really hard,\" she added. \"I was going through IVF, drinking Chinese teas, you name it. I was throwing everything at it. I would've given anything if someone had said to me, 'Freeze your eggs. Do yourself a favor.' You just don't think it. So here I am today. The ship has sailed.\"\n\nShe added, \"I just cared about my career. And God forbid a woman is successful and doesn't have a child. And the reason my husband left me, why we broke up and ended our marriage, was because I wouldn't give him a kid. It was absolute lies. I don't have anything to hide at this point.\"\n\nAniston was married to Brad Pitt from 2000 to 2005 and Justin Theroux from 2015 to 2017.\n\nContributing: Kinsey Crowley\n\nThis article originally Mr. Vance, I pray that your daughter is fortunate enough to bear children of her own one day. I hope she will not need to turn to IVF as a second option. Because you are trying to take that away from her, too.\"\n\nThe post Aniston was replying to featured a tweet by Media Matters editor-in-chief Ron Filipkowski in which he shared part of a 2021 Fox News interview from \"Tucker Carlson Tonight.\" In the clip, the then-Ohio Senate candidate took aim at some Democrats who haven't given birth and said we \"turned our country over to people who don't really have a direct stake in it.\"\n\n\"We're effectively run in this country via the Democrats, via our corporate oligarchs, by a bunch of childless cat ladies who are miserable at their own lives and choices that they've made,\" Vance told Carlson. \"And they want to make the rest of the country miserable, too ... You look at Kamala Harris, Pete Buttigieg, AOC. The entire future of the Democrats is controlled by people without children.\"\n\nVance, who is Ohio's junior senator, was chosen last week to be former President Trump's running mate in the 2024 presidential election. Vance's positions on abortion and IVF have been brought up by Democrats after the announcement.\n\nVance said in 2022 that he'd back a national ban on abortions after 15 weeks, but also indicated that he supports Trump on leaving the question to the states.\n\nHe was among the Senate Republicans who voted in June to block legislation that would protect access to IVF.\n\nAniston opened up about her fertility struggles and IVF journey in 2022. She told Allure magazine that she was trying to get pregnant in her late 30s and 40s and revealed that she tried IVF. \"It was a challenging road for me, the baby-making road,\" she said. However, she has no regrets about how it all turned out.\n\n\"I actually feel a little relief now because there is no more, 'Can I? Maybe. Maybe. Maybe.' {"uri": "8243214459", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-07-25", "time": "14:20:51", "dateTime": "2024-07-25T14:20:51Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-07-25T14:19:46Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.7960784435272217, "url": "https://www.news18.com/world/friends-star-jennifer-aniston-slams-jd-vance-after-clip-of-him-criticising-kamala-harris-for-being-childless-emerges-8978761.html", "title": "'Friends' Star Jennifer Aniston Slams JD Vance After Clip Of Him Criticising Kamala Harris For Being 'Childless' Emerges - News18", "body": "Jennifer Aniston criticised Donald Trump's vice-presidential candidate, JD Vance, for calling Democrats a \"bunch of childless cat ladies with miserable lives\".\n\nActor Jennifer Aniston criticised Donald Trump's vice-presidential candidate, JD Vance, for calling Democrats a \"bunch of childless cat ladies with miserable lives\" after a video from an 2021 interview emerged where he is also seen criticising Kamala Harris for being childless.\n\nShe also shared the video on social media and said she hopes that his daughters are 'fortunate' enough to have children of their own.\n\n\"I truly can't believe that this is coming from a potential VP of the United States. All I can say is... Mr Vance, I pray that your daughter is fortunate enough to bear children of her own one day,\" Aniston, 55, said.\n\nDuring Vance's bid for the Senate in Ohio, he said in a Fox News interview that \"we are effectively run in this country via the Democrats,\" and referred to them as \"a bunch of childless cat ladies who are miserable at their own lives and the choices that they've made and so they want to make the rest of the country miserable, too.\"\n\nHe said that included Harris, US Transportation Secretary Pete Buttigieg and US House of Representatives member Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez, a New York Democrat.\n\n\"I hope she will not need to turn to IVF as a second option. Because you are trying to take that away from her, too,\" she further added.\n\nAniston was referring to Vance voting to block Democrat-proposed legislation to guarantee access to IVF nationwide last month.\n\nHarris is stepmother to the two children of her husband Doug Emhoff and has no biological children.\n\nComments JD Vance made in 2021 questioning Vice President Kamala Harris' leadership is testing Donald Trump's running mate but his campaign has fought back, without directly addressing the clip.\n\nThe clip has started to spread online, with Hillary Clinton sharing it in a Tuesday post on X and adding sarcastically \"what a normal, relatable guy who certainly doesn't hate women having freedoms.\"\n\nVance's spokesperson said the Harris campaign is lying about Vance's views, noting her record is \"littered with countless failures and disasters.\n\n\"It's well known that Senator Vance found success in life due in large part to the influence of strong female role models like his grandmother,\" spokesperson Taylor Van Kirk said.\n\n\"Ugly, personal attacks from JD Vance and Donald Trump are in line with their dangerous Project 2025 agenda to ban abortion, decimate our Mr Vance, I pray that your daughter is fortunate enough to bear children of her own one day.\"\n\nVance has a two-year-old daughter, and two sons.\n\n\"I hope she will not need to turn to IVF as a second option,\" Aniston wrote.\n\n\"Because you are trying to take that away from her, too.\"\n\nThe actress has previously spoken openly about her struggles while trying to have children through in-vitro fertilisation (IVF).\n\nLast month, Vance voted to block Democrat-proposed legislation to guarantee access to IVF nationwide.\n\nIn the clip, Vance criticised Vice-President Kamala Harris because she has no biological children.\n\nHarris is stepmother to her husband Doug Emhoff's two children.\n\nBut Vance told former Fox News host Tucker Carlson the US was run by \"a bunch of childless cat ladies who are miserable at their own lives and the choices that they've made and so they want to make the rest of the country miserable too\".\n\n\"Look at Kamala Harris, Pete Buttigieg, AOC [Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez], the entire future of the Democrats is controlled by people without children,\" he said.\n\n\"How does it make any sense we've turned our country over to people who don't really have a direct stake in it?\"\n\nKamala Harris' stepdaughter, Ella Emhoff, posted a reaction to Vance's comments on Instagram on Thursday.\n\n\"How can you be 'childless' when you have cutie pie kids like cole and I?\" the 25-year-old daughter of Harris' husband, Doug Emhoff, and his ex-wife, Kerstin Emhoff, wrote. Cole Emhoff is her 29-year-old brother.\n\nThe BBC has contacted the Trump-Vance campaign team for comment.\n\nTransportation Secretary Pete Buttigieg also addressed the comments earlier this week, speaking about adopting twins with his husband, Chasten.\n\n\"The really sad thing is he said that after Chasten and I had been through a fairly heartbreaking setback in our adoption journey,\" Buttigieg told CNN's The Source programme.\n\n\"He couldn't have known that - but maybe that's why you shouldn't be talking about other people's children.\"\n\nThere has also been backlash from fans of singer-songwriter Taylor Swift, who has no children - and three cats.\n\n\"It's bold, for someone seeking votes, to hone in on 'childless cat ladies' when the leader of Childless Cat Ladies is Taylor Swift,\" British writer Caitlin Moran posted on X.\n\nAnother X user shared the Time magazine cover where Swift posed with one of her cats, writing: \"Hell hath no fury like a certain childless cat lady who has yet to endorse a presidential candidate.\"\n\nIn 2022, Aniston told Allure she wished someone had told her to freeze her eggs.\n\n\"It was a challenging road for me, the baby-making road,\" she said.\n\n\"All the years and years of speculation... it was really hard.\n\n\"I was going through IVF, drinking Chinese teas, you name it.\"\n\nBut she had \"zero regrets\".\n\n\"I would've given anything if someone had said to me, 'Freeze your eggs. Mr. Vance, I pray that your daughter is fortunate enough to bear children of her own one day. I hope she will not need to turn to IVF as a second option. Because you are trying to take that away from her, too.\"\n\nThe post Aniston was replying to featured a tweet by Media Matters editor-in-chief Ron Filipkowski in which he shared part of a 2021 Fox News interview from \"Tucker Carlson Tonight.\" In the clip, the then-Ohio Senate candidate took aim at some Democrats who haven't given birth and said we \"turned our country over to people who don't really have a direct stake in it.\"\n\n\"We're effectively run in this country via the Democrats, via our corporate oligarchs, by a bunch of childless cat ladies who are miserable at their own lives and choices that they've made,\" Vance told Carlson. \"And they want to make the rest of the country miserable, too ... You look at Kamala Harris, Pete Buttigieg, AOC. The entire future of the Democrats is controlled by people without children.\"\n\nVance, who is Ohio's junior senator, was chosen last week to be former President Trump's running mate in the 2024 presidential election. Vance's positions on abortion and IVF have been brought up by Democrats after the announcement.\n\nVance said in 2022 that he'd back a national ban on abortions after 15 weeks, but also indicated that he supports Trump on leaving the question to the states.\n\nHe was among the Senate Republicans who voted in June to block legislation that would protect access to IVF.\n\nAniston opened up about her fertility struggles and IVF journey in 2022. She told Allure magazine that she was trying to get pregnant in her late 30s and 40s and revealed that she tried IVF. \"It was a challenging road for me, the baby-making road,\" she said. However, she has no regrets about how it all turned out.\n\n\"I actually feel a little relief now because there is no more, 'Can I? Maybe. Maybe. Maybe.' I don't have to think about that anymore,\" she said.\n\nCBS News reached out to Vance's campaign for comment, but did not immediately hear back.\n\nHydrothermal explosion sends water, rocks flying at In the clip, Vance, who is Donald Trump's running mate, said the country was being led by Democrats who are \"a bunch of childless cat ladies who are miserable at their own lives and the choices that they've made and so they want to make the rest of the country miserable, too.\" It's assumed he was attacking people like Vice President Kamala Harris, who does not have biological children.\n\nCue former Secretary of State Hillary Clinton, who has helped the clip go viral:\n\nIn that interview, Vance also told host Tucker Carlson (because of course it was Tucker Carlson) that these \"childless\" Democrats \"don't really have a direct stake\" in our country.\n\nThanks to Clinton sharing that clip, the Harris campaign had a chance to clap back at Vance, saying that \"every single American has a stake in this country's future.\"\n\n\"Ugly, personal attacks from JD Vance and Donald Trump are in line with their dangerous Project 2025 agenda to ban abortion, decimate our democracy, and gut Social Security,\" James Singer, a Harris campaign spokesman, told the Associated Press.\n\nThough Harris may not have biological children, she is not in fact childless. When she married lawyer Doug Emhoff in 2014, she became the stepmother of his two children, Ella and Cole, who refer to her as \"Momala.\" No word on if Vance considers blended families valid.", {"uri": "2024-07-433303787", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-07-25", "time": "12:46:43", "dateTime": "2024-07-25T12:46:43Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-07-25T12:42:58Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.772549033164978, "url": "https://ca.news.yahoo.com/aniston-slams-jd-vances-childless-103413934.html", "title": "Aniston criticises 'childless cat ladies' comment", "body": "Jennifer Aniston has criticised Donald Trump's vice-presidential candidate, JD Vance, for resurfaced comments calling Democrats a \"bunch of childless cat ladies with miserable lives\".\n\nThe Friends actress, 55, posted a 2021 interview with Mr Vance that has been widely shared since his selection as Mr Trump's running mate for November's presidential election.\n\n\"I truly can't believe that this is coming from a potential VP of the United States,\" she wrote on Instagram.\n\n\"All I can say is... Mr Vance, I pray that your daughter is fortunate enough to bear children of her own one day.\"\n\nMr Vance has a two-year-old daughter, and two sons.\n\n\"I hope she will not need to turn to IVF as a second option,\" Ms Aniston wrote.\n\n\"Because you are trying to take that away from her, too.\"\n\n'Country miserable'\n\nThe actress has previously spoken openly about her struggles while trying to have children through in-vitro fertilisation (IVF).\n\nLast month, Mr Vance voted to block Democrat-proposed legislation to guarantee access to IVF nationwide.\n\nIn the clip, Mr Vance criticised Vice-President Kamala Harris because she has no biological children.\n\nMs Harris is stepmother to her husband Doug Emhoff's two children.\n\nBut Mr Vance told former Fox News host Tucker Carlson the US was run by \"a bunch of childless cat ladies who are miserable at their own lives and the choices that they've made and so they want to make the rest of the country miserable too\".\n\n\"Look at Kamala Harris, Pete Buttigieg, AOC [Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez], the entire future of the Democrats is controlled by people without children,\" he said.\n\n\"How does it make any sense we've turned our country over to people who don't really have a direct stake in it?\"\n\n'Heartbreaking setback'\n\nTransportation Secretary Pete Buttigieg also addressed the comments earlier this week, speaking about adopting twins with his husband, Chasten.\n\n\"The really sad thing is he said that after Chasten and I had been through a fairly heartbreaking setback in our adoption journey,\" Mr Buttigieg told CNN's The Source programme.\n\n\"He couldn't have known that - but maybe that's why you shouldn't be talking about other people's children.\"\n\nThere has also been backlash from fans of singer-songwriter Taylor Swift, who has no children - and three cats.\n\n\"It's bold, for someone seeking votes, to hone in on 'childless cat ladies' when the leader of Childless Cat Ladies is Taylor Swift,\" British writer Caitlin Moran posted on X.\n\nAnother X user shared the Time magazine cover where Swift posed with one of her cats, writing: \"Hell hath no fury like a certain childless cat lady who has yet to endorse a presidential candidate.\"\n\n\"It was a challenging road for me, the baby-making road,\" she said.\n\n\"All the years and years of speculation... it was really hard.\n\n\"I was going through IVF, drinking Chinese teas, you name it.\"\n\nBut she had \"zero regrets\".\n\n\"I would've given anything if someone had said to me, 'Freeze your eggs. Do yourself a favour.' You just don't think it. {"uri": "8242862269", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-07-25", "time": "10:39:19", "dateTime": "2024-07-25T10:39:19Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-07-25T10:35:07Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.7686274647712708, "url": "https://ca.news.yahoo.com/jennifer-aniston-condemns-jd-vances-102600906.html", "title": "Jennifer Aniston condemns JD Vance's 'childless cat ladies' remarks", "body": "Jennifer Aniston has condemned JD Vance, Donald Trump's vice presidential candidate, for resurfaced comments in which he disparaged Democrat women as a \"bunch of childless cat ladies with miserable lives\" who are \"making the country miserable too\".\n\nOn Wednesday the Friends star posted a clip of Mr Vance's remarks on her Instagram story, expressing her disbelief.\n\nShe penned: \"I truly can't believe that this is coming from a potential VP of the United States.\"\n\nAniston used the moment to directly address Mr Vance and criticise his views on IVF, adding: \"All I can say is... Mr Vance, I pray that your daughter is fortunate enough to bear children of her own one day.\n\n\"I hope she will not need to turn to IVF as a second option. Because you are trying to take that away from her, too.\"\n\nIn a 2021 interview with former Fox News host Tucker Carlson, JD Vance criticised Vice President Kamala Harris' leadership, questioning it due to her lack of biological children.\n\nAs the presidential election approaches, the video has resurfaced, with many women without children labeling Mr Vance's comments as sexist and misogynistic.\n\nThey argue that his remarks perpetuate the outdated stereotype that women who choose not to have children are lonely and unloved.\n\nMr Vance said in the clip that the country was run by \"a bunch of childless cat ladies who are miserable at their own lives and the choices that they've made and so they want to make the rest of the country miserable too\".\n\nHe continued: \"Look at Kamala Harris, Pete Buttigieg, AOC, the entire future of the Democrats is controlled by people without children. How does it make any sense we've turned our country over to people who don't really have a direct stake in it?\"\n\nVice President Harris, one of the politiciansMr Vance referred to as a \"childless cat lady\", addressed his views on IVF and abortion during a campaign speech last week in Kalamazoo, Michigan.\n\nShe shared: \"Understand, this is a fellow who -- in the United States Senate -- participated in blocking protections for IVF. This is an individual who has made every indication that he is for a national abortion ban.\"\n\nIn June, Mr Vance voted against the Right to IVF Act, which aimed to ensure nationwide accessibility to IVF services.\n\nAniston, who has been candid about her own IVF journey, has consistently challenged the stereotype that women without children are somehow incomplete or unsuccessful.\n\nIn a 2016 essay for the Huffington Post, the Hollywood emphasised that women do not need to be married or mothers to lead fulfilling lives.\n\nThe 55-year-old wrote: \"We get to decide for ourselves what is beautiful when it comes to our bodies. That decision is ours and ours alone.\n\n\"Let's make that decision for ourselves and for the young women in this world who look to us as examples.\"", "source": {"uri": "ca.news.yahoo.com", {"uri": "8241578436", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-07-24", "time": "16:02:49", "dateTime": "2024-07-24T16:02:49Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-07-24T16:02:08Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.7686274647712708, "url": "https://people.com/jd-vance-2021-comment-calling-kamala-harris-childless-cat-lady-sparks-reaction-8682736", "title": "J.D. Vance Once Called Kamala Harris a 'Childless Cat Lady.' Now Real-Life 'Cat Ladies' Have Thoughts", "body": "Virginia Chamlee is a Politics Writer at PEOPLE. She has been working at PEOPLE for three years. Her work has previously appeared in The Washington Post, Buzzfeed, Eater, and other outlets.\n\nComments made by Republican vice presidential nominee J.D. Vance in a 2021 interview are now resurfacing -- and stirring conversation among people who either don't want, or can't have, children.\n\nYears before he was selected as Donald Trump's running mate, Vance gave an interview with then-Fox News host Tucker Carlson in July 2021. During the conversation, Vance said the U.S. was being run, under Democratic leadership, by \"a bunch of childless cat ladies who are miserable at their own lives and the choices that they've made and so they want to make the rest of the country miserable, too. \"\n\n\"It's just a basic fact -- you look at Kamala Harris, Pete Buttigieg, AOC -- the entire future of the Democrats is controlled by people without children,\" Vance, 39, told Carlson. And how does it make any sense that we've turned our country over to people who don't really have a direct stake in it?\"\n\nVance went on to say that those who \"actually have kids\" are \"the people who have a more direct stake in the future of this country.\"\n\nThat Vance, who has three children with wife Usha Chilukuri Vance, called out three \"childless\" Democrats by name is particularly noteworthy -- in part, because it's not true. One of them, Harris, became a stepmom to her husband Doug Emhoff's two children in August 2014. Now the presumptive Democratic nominee for president, Harris has for years spoken openly about her close relationship with her stepchildren, who refer to her as \"Momala.\"\n\nButtigieg, meanwhile, now the Secretary of Transportation, does have children: twins he adopted with husband Chasten in September 2021, just weeks after Vance's interview aired.\n\nNew York Rep. Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez, meanwhile, does not have children. But as critics of Vance's comments have weighed in: so what?\n\nNever miss a story -- sign up for PEOPLE's free daily newsletter to stay up-to-date on the best of what PEOPLE has to offer, from celebrity news to compelling human interest stories.\n\nFlorida state Rep. Anna Eskamani chided Vance for his comments in a post on X, writing, \"As a childless cat lady I have a huge stake in America and am not miserable but thanks for your concern, Vance.\"\n\nFormer Sec. of State Hillary Clinton, who ran for the presidency against Trump in 2016, wrote sarcastically: \"What a normal, relatable guy who certainly doesn't hate women having freedoms,\"\n\nOthers have expressed similar thoughts, questioning why someone without biological children is less invested in the good of the country than someone with children.\n\n\"Calling step-mom Kamala Harris a childless cat lady is going to enrage not just single women but all the parents of step-kids who are having their parenting denigrated,\" one user on X wrote. \" Vance's history of misogyny is just an endless wellspring of hate to highlight.\"\n\nAnother offered a more sarcastic assessment of the Republican's comments, asking: \"Should really help win over women voters, huh?\"\n\nSpeaking to CNN's Kaitlan Collins this week, Buttigieg noted that the comments directed at him came at a time when he and his husband \"had been through a fairly heartbreaking setback in our adoption journey.\"\n\n\"[Vance] couldn't have known that, but maybe that's why you shouldn't be talking about other people's children,\" Buttigieg added.\n\nAnd many others have seized on a very famous cat-owner without kids -- Taylor Swift, sharing photos of her 2023 TIME Person of the Year (on which she appeared alongside one of her cats) in response to Vance's comments.\n\nAs Guardian columnist Arwa Mahdawi wrote, though, it is possible Vance didn't actually mean what he said back in 2021, especially considering his track record (though now Trump's running mate, he previously called the former president \"America's Hitler\" and called himself \"a never Trump guy.\"\n\nMahdawi cites data that shows that many women who are unmarried and childless aren't unhappy in the slightest -- in fact, the opposite, often ranking higher in terms of health and happiness than those with children.\n\nOthers have simply taken Vance's comments and run with them, espousing Vance's comments as something of a rallying cry. {"uri": "8243422114", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-07-25", "time": "16:50:49", "dateTime": "2024-07-25T16:50:49Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-07-25T16:48:56Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.7647058963775635, "url": "https://www.yahoo.com/news/aniston-slams-jd-vances-childless-103413934.html", "title": "Aniston criticises JD Vance's 'childless cat ladies' comment", "body": "Jennifer Aniston has criticised Donald Trump's vice-presidential candidate, JD Vance, for resurfaced comments calling Democrats a \"bunch of childless cat ladies with miserable lives\".\n\nThe Friends actress, 55, posted a 2021 interview with Mr Vance that has been widely shared since his selection as Mr Trump's running mate for November's presidential election.\n\n\"I truly can't believe that this is coming from a potential VP of the United States,\" she wrote on Instagram.\n\n\"All I can say is... Mr Vance, I pray that your daughter is fortunate enough to bear children of her own one day.\"\n\nMr Vance has a two-year-old daughter, and two sons.\n\n\"I hope she will not need to turn to IVF as a second option,\" Ms Aniston wrote.\n\n\"Because you are trying to take that away from her, too.\"\n\nThe actress has previously spoken openly about her struggles while trying to have children through in-vitro fertilisation (IVF).\n\nLast month, Mr Vance voted to block Democrat-proposed legislation to guarantee access to IVF nationwide.\n\nIn the clip, Mr Vance criticised Vice-President Kamala Harris because she has no biological children.\n\nMs Harris is stepmother to her husband Doug Emhoff's two children.\n\nBut Mr Vance told former Fox News host Tucker Carlson the US was run by \"a bunch of childless cat ladies who are miserable at their own lives and the choices that they've made and so they want to make the rest of the country miserable too\".\n\n\"Look at Kamala Harris, Pete Buttigieg, AOC [Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez], the entire future of the Democrats is controlled by people without children,\" he said.\n\n\"How does it make any sense we've turned our country over to people who don't really have a direct stake in it?\"\n\nKamala Harris' stepdaughter, Ella Emhoff, posted a reaction to Mr Vance's comments on Instagram on Thursday.\n\n\"How can you be 'childless' when you have cutie pie kids like cole and I?\" the 25-year-old daughter of Harris' husband, Doug Emhoff, and his ex-wife, Kerstin Emhoff, wrote. Cole Emhoff is her 29-year-old brother.\n\nThe BBC has contacted the Trump-Vance campaign team for comment.\n\nTransportation Secretary Pete Buttigieg also addressed the comments earlier this week, speaking about adopting twins with his husband, Chasten.\n\n\"The really sad thing is he said that after Chasten and I had been through a fairly heartbreaking setback in our adoption journey,\" Mr Buttigieg told CNN's The Source programme.\n\n\"He couldn't have known that - but maybe that's why you shouldn't be talking about other people's children.\"\n\nThere has also been backlash from fans of singer-songwriter Taylor Swift, who has no children - and three cats.\n\n\"It's bold, for someone seeking votes, to hone in on 'childless cat ladies' when the leader of Childless Cat Ladies is Taylor Swift,\" British writer Caitlin Moran posted on X.\n\nAnother X user shared the Time magazine cover where Swift posed with one of her cats, writing: \"Hell hath no fury like a certain childless cat lady who has yet to endorse a presidential candidate.\"\n\nIn 2022, Aniston told Allure she wished someone had told her to freeze her eggs.\n\n\"It was a challenging road for me, the baby-making road,\" she said.\n\n\"All the years and years of speculation... it was really hard.\n\n\"I was going through IVF, drinking Chinese teas, you name it.\"\n\nBut she had \"zero regrets\".\n\n\"I would've given anything if someone had said to me, 'Freeze your eggs. Do yourself a favour.' You just don't think it. {"uri": "8243368685", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-07-25", "time": "16:10:10", "dateTime": "2024-07-25T16:10:10Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-07-25T16:09:22Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.7647058963775635, "url": "https://www.eastbaytimes.com/2024/07/25/jennifer-aniston-prays-for-the-future-fertility-of-jd-vances-daughter-to-slam-his-childless-women-comments/", "title": "Jennifer Aniston 'prays' for the future fertility of J.D. Vance's daughter to slam his childless women comments", "body": "Jennifer Aniston isn't holding back when it comes to addressing J.D. Vance's resurfaced comments about the misery of childless women, saying she hopes his own daughter will never struggle with infertility or with trying to get pregnant via in vitro fertilization, a procedure that Donald Trump's running mate has voted against making more accessible.\n\n\"I truly can't believe this is coming from a potential VP of The United States,\" the \"Friends\" alum wrote on her Instagram Story Wednesday, according to The Hollywood Reporter. \"All I can say is ... Mr. Vance, I pray that your daughter is fortunate enough to bear children of her own one day.\"\n\nAniston has opened up in the past about trying to conceive via IVF and about dealing with media gossip about her not having children. She continued to cite Vance's 2-year-old daughter Mirabel as she blasted the incendiary comments he made in 2021, when the father of three said that miserable \"cat ladies\" are running the Democratic Party and that people without children have no stake in the country's future.\n\nAniston said: \"I hope she will not need to turn to IVF as a second option. Because you are trying to take that away from her, too.\" The \"Friends\" alum is referring to Vance, an Ohio senator, joining other Senate Republicans in June to vote down a bill that would have established a nationwide right to IVF and other assisted reproductive technology, and would have made these procedures more affordable and accessible.\n\nIn her post, Aniston shared a screenshot of a tweet, which featured Vance's July 2021 interview with then-Fox News host Tucker Carlson. In the clip, the conservative former venture capitalist can be heard saying the United States was being run by \"a bunch of childless cat ladies who are miserable in their own lives and with the choices that they've made and so they want to make the rest of the country miserable, too.\"\n\n\"It's just a basic fact -- you look at Kamala Harris, Pete Buttigieg, AOC -- the entire future of the Democrats is controlled by people without children,\" Vance continued, referencing U.S. Rep Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez, D-New York City, in the interview. \"And how does it make any sense that we've turned our country over to people who don't really have a direct stake in it?\"\n\nIn his diatribe, Vance falsely characterized Harris and Buttigieg's status as parents. Vice President Harris, the presumptive Democratic presidential nominee, is the stepmother to her husband's son and daughter, while Transportation Secretary Buttigieg and his husband adopted twin newborns in November 2021.\n\nAniston's comments come a week after Trump, the Republican presidential nominee, picked Vance as his vice president at the Republican National Convention ahead of the 2024 election. Vance and his wife Usha share three children, Miracle, 2, Vivek, 4, and Ewan, 6.\n\nThe Emmy-winning actress has previously addressed false rumors that she's dealt with her entire career -- reports that she's pregnant, trying to get pregnant or that she prioritized her career over having children. She told Allure in 2022 that it was \"really hard\" to see the fake reports, while revealing that she had tried to conceive through IVF.\n\n\"All the years and years and years of speculation ... It was really hard,\" Aniston said at the time. \"I was going through IVF, drinking Chinese teas, you name it. I was throwing everything at it. I would have given anything if someone had said to me, 'Freeze your eggs. Do yourself a favor.' You just don't think it.\"\n\nBefore that, she wrote an essay for the Huffington Post in 2016, saying she was completely \"fed up\" with the way that women often face scrutiny if they don't have children after a certain point.\n\n\"Here's where I come out on this topic: We are complete with or without a mate, with or without a child. We get to decide for ourselves what is beautiful when it comes to our bodies. That decision is ours and ours alone,\" Aniston wrote. \"Let's make that decision for ourselves and for the young women in this world who look to us as examples. Let's make that decision consciously, outside of the tabloid noise. We don't need to be married or mothers to be complete. {"uri": "8240563351", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-07-24", "time": "05:12:15", "dateTime": "2024-07-24T05:12:15Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-07-24T05:11:28Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.7607843279838562, "url": "https://www.hindustantimes.com/world-news/us-news/jd-vance-faces-wrath-of-taylor-swift-fans-after-old-clip-shows-him-blasting-childless-cat-ladies-hell-hath-no-fury-101721796595971.html", "title": "JD Vance faces Swifties' wrath after old clip shows him blasting 'childless cat ladies': 'Hell hath no fury like...'", "body": "JD Vance has gone viral after a resurfaced clip showed him making remarks about vice president Kamala Harris and others, which have been slammed as \"sexist.\" In the 2021 clip, Donald Trump's running mate was heard telling former Fox News host Tucker Carlson that the country was run by \"a bunch of childless cat ladies who are miserable at their own lives and the choices that they've made and so they want to make the rest of the country miserable too.\"\n\n\"Look at Kamala Harris, Pete Buttigieg, AOC, the entire future of the Democrats is controlled by people without children,\" Vance added. \"How does it make any sense we've turned our country over to people who don't really have a direct stake in it?\"\n\nNow, as the clip resurfaced, Vance began facing the wrath of fans of Taylor Swift, who is childless and is a proud cat mom. She is known to have several cats, including two Scottish Folds named Olivia Benson and Meredith Grey and a Ragdoll cat named Benjamin Button.\n\nAn X post with an image of Swift with a cat is captioned, \"hell hath no fury like a certain childless cat lady who has yet to endorse a presidential candidate\". Many users took to the comment section, with one of them saying, \"A lot of cat ladies are gonna be mad\". \"So sick of the \"baby factory\" misogyny,\" one user said, while another wrote, \"I hope @taylorswift13 comes out for Kamala and against all these sexist comments from the Trumplican party and Trump himself.\"\n\n\"Do they think that childless single people don't vote?!\" one user wrote, while another said, \"News flash, JD, not all men want kids either. My husband didn't, thank God. We have had lots of cats over the years though. And we're quite happy.\" \"They will go absolutely mad when Swift endorses VP Harris. Just a matter of time. @taylorswift13, how about some concerts in your native PA and also MI, AZ, NC and GA?\" one user wrote.\n\nThe resurfaced clip came after Joe Biden dropped out of the race and endorsed Harris. Harris is married to longtime entertainment lawyer Doug Emhoff, and has two step-children named Ella and Cole Emhoff.\n\nDuring the conversation with Carlson, Vance also suggested that \"if we want a healthy ruling class in this country, we should invest more, we should vote more, we should support more people who actually have kids. Because those are the people who ultimately have a more direct stake in the future of this country.\"\n\nOn facing backlash for his comments, Vance had said that he believes he \"struck a nerve.\" \"I mean, these people recognize that they're unhappy. They're living in one-bedroom apartments in New York City. They've played their entire lives to win a status game. They're obsessed with their jobs,\" he said, suggesting that they \"hate normal Americans for choosing family.\" Vance also said that these people would be \"happier coming home to a smiling kid\" than \"worrying about their crappy job.\"\n\nHarris, however, has appeared to be perfectly happy in her personal life. She wrote in Elle in 2019, \"I was already hooked on Doug, but I believe it was Cole and Ella who reeled me in.\"\n\n\"A few years later when Doug and I got married, Cole, Ella, and I agreed that we didn't like the term 'stepmom.' Vance, who was then running for US Senate in Ohio, said the country was run by Democrats whom he called \"a bunch of childless cat ladies who are miserable at their own lives and the choices that they've made, and so they want to make the rest of the country miserable, too.\"\n\n\"The entire future of the Democrats is controlled by people without children,\" Vance said, targeting Transportation Secretary Pete Buttigieg, Representative Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez, and Vice President Kamala Harris in his comment. \"How does it make any sense that we've turned our country over to people who don't really have a direct stake in it?\" (When Harris married Douglas Emhoff in 2014, she became stepmother to his two children.)\n\nThe attacks from Vance about \"people who don't have children\" -- which he has made publicly more than once -- have reverberated with politicians, media figures, and everyday Americans who've denounced the statements as \"hurtful and mean.\"\n\nOn Tuesday, Aniston, who has previously spoken about her fertility struggles, took issue with Vance's comments.\n\n\"Mr. Vance, I pray that your daughter is fortunate enough to bear children of her own one day. I hope she will not need to turn to IVF as a second option. Because you are trying to take that away from her, too,\" said Aniston, referring to the push by some Republicans to ban access to in vitro fertilization. Her comments came one day before World IVF Day, which recognizes the advancement of the fertility treatment.\n\nIn a 2022 interview with Allure, Aniston discussed the difficulties she faced trying to become pregnant, amid constant speculation by the tabloids.\n\n\"All the years and years and years of speculation... It was really hard. I was going through IVF, drinking Chinese teas, you name it. I was throwing everything at it,\" she said. \"I would've given anything if someone had said to me, 'Freeze your eggs. Do yourself a favor.' You just don't think it. So here I am today. The ship has sailed.\"\n\nMeghan McCain, a conservative commentator and the daughter of the late Senator John McCain, also called Vance out for his comments.\n\n\"One of my best friends did rounds and rounds of unsuccessful IVF wanting to have a child. It is still painful to talk about,\" she wrote on X, formerly Twitter. \"This 'childless women' comment by JD Vance has made so many waves with so many different friends of mine for it's insensitivity {"uri": "8243266987", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-07-25", "time": "14:56:49", "dateTime": "2024-07-25T14:56:49Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-07-25T14:56:09Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.7607843279838562, "url": "https://perezhilton.com/jennifer-aniston-slams-jd-vance-women-without-children/", "title": "Jennifer Aniston Slams Republican VP Candidate JD Vance For HORRIFIC Comments About Women Without Children! - Perez Hilton", "body": "Jennifer Aniston has seen what JD Vance is all about, and she wants NO part of him anywhere near the White House.\n\nVance, of course, is the Hillbilly Elegy author turned United States Senator from Ohio who has now been picked to be Donald Trump's running mate for this election cycle. On Wednesday night, the Friends actress reshared a video of Vance saying something truly shocking about women that should have us ALL incredibly concerned.\n\nRelated: Donald Trump 'S**tting His Pants' Now That Biden Dropped Out, Say Critics!\n\nAniston took to her Instagram Stories account to share the clip -- and comment on it, too. The video itself was from a 2021 interview Vance did on Fox News with then-anchor Tucker Carlson. During that interview, which took place while Vance was running for Senate, the current VP candidate slammed Democrat politicians like Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez, Pete Buttigieg, and Kamala Harris. The charge? Being childless!\n\nIn that old clip, Vance moaned about how \"childless cat ladies\" are controlling the Democrats, and thus, controlling the country. He said in part to Carlson:\n\n\"It's just a basic fact. You look at Kamala Harris, Pete Buttigieg, AOC -- the entire future of the Democrats is controlled by people without children. And how does it make any sense that we've turned our country over to people who don't really have a direct stake in it?\"\n\nAnd he went on:\n\n\"[They are] a bunch of childless cat ladies who are miserable at their own lives and the choices that they've made and so they want to make the rest of the country miserable, too.\"\n\nYeesh!\n\nThe 55-year-old sitcom star couldn't abide by that, though. And she used IG to fight back! Sharing a clip of the offensive quote on Wednesday evening, she first wrote above it:\n\n\"I truly can't believe this is coming from a potential VP of The United States.\"\n\nThen, below the video, Aniston added this particularly poignant follow-up:\n\n\"All I can say is... Mr. Vance, I pray that your daughter is fortunate enough to bear children of her own one day. I hope she will not need to turn to IVF as a second option. Because you are trying to take that away from her too\"\n\nWow. Very powerful! And VERY true!! See the post for yourself (below):\n\nHere's the original video of Vance saying those awful words, BTW:\n\nNow, for one, Harris actually does have kids: she's the stepmother to her husband Doug Emhoff's two children -- son Cole, 29, and daughter Ella, 25. But oooooookay, JD!\n\nAs for Aniston, the child chat and pregnancy discussion no doubt hits home. She's been plagued by pregnancy rumors throughout her career, and has also tried to bring children into this world, but it never happened for her. Back in November of 2022, she recalled to Allure how difficult it was for her to try to have a baby while with ex-husband Brad Pitt and at other points in her younger years:\n\n\"All the years and years and years of speculation... It was really hard. I was going through IVF, drinking Chinese teas, you name it. I was throwing everything at it. I would have given anything if someone had said to me, 'Freeze your eggs. Do yourself a favor.' You just don't think it.\"\n\nShe also followed up with that outlet at the time:\n\n\"Here I am today. The ship has sailed... I actually feel a little relief now because there is no more, 'Can I?' I don't have to think about that anymore.\"\n\nSo, she has been through it emotionally on both sides of the debate -- trying to have them as a younger woman, and not being able to do so and moving on with life beyond motherhood. She knows of what she speaks! And she certainly knows it better than JD Vance... just saying!\n\nReactions, y'all? All I can say is... Because you are trying to take that away from her, too.\"\n\nAniston's comments appear to be in reference to Mr Vance's voting with senate Republicans to block legislation that would have established a national right to IVF last month.\n\nAniston has previously discussed how she unsuccessfully tried to have children through IVF.\n\n\"It was a challenging road for me, the baby-making road,\" the Friends star told Allure in 2022. \"All the years and years of speculation... it was really hard. {"uri": "8243700691", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-07-25", "time": "21:14:53", "dateTime": "2024-07-25T21:14:53Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-07-25T21:13:41Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.7529411911964417, "url": "https://www.huffpost.com/entry/jd-vance-childless-cat-ladies-backlash_n_66a2b1a0e4b0ac6125bde806", "title": "Here Comes The Backlash To JD Vance's 'Childless Cat Ladies' Comment From 2021", "body": "Donald Trump's running mate dissed Kamala Harris and other Democrats as \"childless cat ladies\" out to make everyone miserable.\n\nDonald Trump's vice presidential running mate, JD Vance, drew high-profile backlash this week for his remark in 2021 about top Democrats, such as Vice President Kamala Harris, being \"childless cat ladies.\"\n\nKerstin Emhoff, a film producer and the ex-wife of second gentleman Doug Emhoff, called the comments \"baseless attacks,\" pointing out Thursday that Harris has for years been a co-parent of their children.\n\n\"She is loving, nurturing, fiercely protective and always present,\" Kerstin Emhoff told CNN. \"I love our blended family and am grateful to have her in it.\"\n\nEmhoff's fact check followed criticism from celebrities such as Whoopi Goldberg and Jennifer Aniston.\n\n\"I truly can't believe this is coming from a potential VP of The United States,\" Aniston, the \"Friends\" star, said on Instagram. \"All I can say is...Mr. Vance, I pray that your daughter is fortunate enough to bear children of her own one day.\"\n\nThe Trump-Vance campaign hasn't responded to the criticism.\n\nIn 2021, Vance blasted the \"childless left\" in a speech, arguing that people without children have less of a stake in the country's future. He followed the speech with an incendiary interview on Fox News in which he specifically mentioned Rep. Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez, Transportation Secretary Pete Buttigieg and Harris.\n\n\"We're effectively run in this country, via the Democrats, via our corporate oligarchs, by a bunch of childless cat ladies who are miserable at their own lives and the choices that they've made and so they want to make the rest of the country miserable too,\" Vance, now a U.S. senator from Ohio, said at the time.\n\n\"It's just a basic fact: You look at Kamala Harris, Pete Buttigieg, AOC, the entire future of the Democrats is controlled by people without children,\" he said. \"And how does it make any sense that we've turned our country over to people that don't have a direct stake in it?\"\n\nThe remarks drew wider attention after Trump named Vance as his running mate last week.\n\nIn case anyone missed it, on Thursday the Harris campaign posted a clip of the interview to its 1 million followers on X, the website formerly known as Twitter. And in an email heralding World IVF Day, the Harris campaign said Vance \"is driving away voters in droves, insulting couples struggling with infertility who are sounding off on his disparaging comments about 'childless' women.\"\n\nIn vitro fertilization emerged as a major political issue this year after an Alabama Supreme Court decision put IVF procedures on shaky legal footing. The decision followed the U.S. Supreme Court's overturning of Roe v. Wade, the federal right to an abortion, and put Republicans on the defensive. Trump has insisted his would defend IVF if he's elected president.\n\nButtigieg and Minnesota Gov. Tim Walz of Minnesota, both potential vice presidential picks for Harris, also piped up about the \"cat ladies\" comment on Wednesday.\n\n\"Go ahead and continue to denigrate people. My God, they went after cat people. Good luck with that,\" Walz said on MSNBC. \"Turn on the internet and see what cat people do when you go after them.\"\n\nButtigieg, for his part, told CNN that Vance listed him as a \"childless cat lady\" at a time when he and his husband had had a \"heartbreaking setback\" in their efforts to adopt children. (They now have twins.)\n\n\"He couldn't have known that,\" Buttigieg said of Vance, \"but maybe that's why you shouldn't be talking about other people's children.\"", "source": {"uri": "huffpost.com", {"uri": "2024-07-433559320", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-07-25", "time": "16:46:05", "dateTime": "2024-07-25T16:46:05Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-07-25T16:31:03Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.7529411911964417, "url": "https://internewscast.com/news/us/jennifer-aniston-criticizes-jd-vance-for-his-remarks-about-women-without-children-in-an-old-interview-that-recently-surfaced/", "title": "Jennifer Aniston criticizes JD Vance for his remarks about \"women without children\" in an old interview that recently surfaced - Internewscast Journal", "body": "Actor Jennifer Aniston, who has been open about her fertility struggles, slammed Sen. JD Vance over a resurfaced 2021 interview in which he said the United States was being run by \"a bunch of childless cat ladies.\"\n\n\"I truly can't believe this is coming from a potential VP of The United States,\" Aniston wrote Wednesday in an Instagram story, including a clip of Vance's comments.\n\nThe interview gained fresh traction this week after it was posted on X, days after former President Donald Trump announced that the Republican senator from Ohio would be his vice presidential running mate.\n\nDuring a 2021 appearance on Tucker Carlson's former Fox News show, Vance said that the country was being led \"by a bunch of childless cat ladies who are miserable at their own lives and the choices that they've made.\"\n\n\"So they want to make the rest of the country miserable too,\" Vance continued. \"And it's just a basic fact. If you look at Kamala Harris, Pete Buttigieg, [Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez], the entire future of the Democrats is controlled by people without children. And how does it make any sense that we've turned our country over to people who don't really have a direct stake in it?\"\n\nHarris, who has two stepchildren, is now running for president after President Joe Biden dropped out of the 2024 race. Buttigieg, the transportation secretary, has adopted twins.\n\nVance went on to say in the clip that he believes people \"who go home at night and see the face of a smiling kid, whatever their profession, I think they're happier, I think they're healthier, and they're going to be better prepared to actually lead this country.\"\n\nAniston also called out Vance over his far-right stance on reproductive rights.\n\n\"All I can say is... Mr. Vance, I pray that your daughter is fortunate enough to bear children of her own one day,\" Aniston wrote. \"I hope she will not need to turn to IVF as a second option. Because you are trying to take that away from her, too.\"\n\nThe actor told Allure in 2022 that she tried to get pregnant for many years but \"it was a challenging road\" for her.\n\n\"I was going through IVF, drinking Chinese teas, you name it,\" she said. \"I was throwing everything at it. I would've given anything if someone had said to me, 'Freeze your eggs. Do yourself a favor.' You just don't think it. So here I am today. The ship has sailed.\"\n\nAniston, 55, said the constant media scrutiny and false claims that she didn't want children because she was \"selfish\" were hurtful.\n\nWhile the actor did not officially back Harris, the Instagram post comes as many in Hollywood have begun publicly broadcasting their enthusiasm for the vice president's campaign.\n\nJosh Gad, Sheryl Lee Ralph, Barbra Streisand and Kerry Washington were among the flood of actors to voice their support. Vance's daughter to slam his childless women comments", "body": "Aniston makes it personal while blasting the GOP vice presidential candidate for disparaging women who don't have children and for opposing legislation that would have made IVF more affordable and accessible\n\nJennifer Aniston isn't holding back when it comes to addressing J.D. Vance's resurfaced comments about the misery of childless women, saying she hopes his own daughter will never struggle with infertility or with trying to get pregnant via in vitro fertilization, a procedure that Donald Trump's running mate has voted against making more accessible.\n\n\"I truly can't believe this is coming from a potential VP of The United States,\" the \"Friends\" alum wrote on her Instagram Story Wednesday, according to The Hollywood Reporter. \"All I can say is ... Mr. Vance, I pray that your daughter is fortunate enough to bear children of her own one day.\"\n\nAniston has opened up in the past about trying to conceive via IVF and about dealing with media gossip about her not having children. She continued to cite Vance's 2-year-old daughter Mirabel as she blasted the incendiary comments he made in 2021, when the father of three said that miserable \"cat ladies\" are running the Democratic Party and that people without children have no stake in the country's future.\n\nAniston said: \"I hope she will not need to turn to IVF as a second option. Because you are trying to take that away from her, too.\" The \"Friends\" alum is referring to Vance, an Ohio senator, joining other Senate Republicans in June to vote down a bill that would have established a nationwide right to IVF and other assisted reproductive technology, and would have made these procedures more affordable and accessible.\n\nIn her post, Aniston shared a screenshot of a tweet, which featured Vance's July 2021 interview with then-Fox News host Tucker Carlson. In the clip, the conservative former venture capitalist can be heard saying the United States was being run by \"a bunch of childless cat ladies who are miserable in their own lives and with the choices that they've made and so they want to make the rest of the country miserable, too.\"\n\n\"It's just a basic fact -- you look at Kamala Harris, Pete Buttigieg, AOC -- the entire future of the Democrats is controlled by people without children,\" Vance continued, referencing U.S. Rep Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez, D-New York City, in the interview. \"And how does it make any sense that we've turned our country over to people who don't really have a direct stake in it?\"\n\nIn his diatribe, Vance falsely characterized Harris and Buttigieg's status as parents. Vice President Harris, the presumptive Democratic presidential nominee, is the stepmother to her husband's son and daughter, while Transportation Secretary Buttigieg and his husband adopted twin newborns in November 2021.\n\nAniston's comments come a week after Trump, the Republican presidential nominee, picked Vance as his vice president at the Republican National Convention ahead of the 2024 election. Vance and his wife Usha share three children, Miracle, 2, Vivek, 4, and Ewan, 6.\n\nThe Emmy-winning actress has previously addressed false rumors that she's dealt with her entire career -- reports that she's pregnant, trying to get pregnant or that she prioritized her career over having children. She told Allure in 2022 that it was \"really hard\" to see the fake reports, while revealing that she had tried to conceive through IVF.\n\n\"All the years and years and years of speculation ... It was really hard,\" Aniston said at the time. \"I was going through IVF, drinking Chinese teas, you name it. I was throwing everything at it. I would have given anything if someone had said to me, 'Freeze your eggs. Do yourself a favor.' You just don't think it.\"\n\nBefore that, she wrote an essay for the Huffington Post in 2016, saying she was completely \"fed up\" with the way that women often face scrutiny if they don't have children after a certain point.\n\n\"Here's where I come out on this topic: We are complete with or without a mate, with or without a child. We get to decide for ourselves what is beautiful when it comes to our bodies. That decision is ours and ours alone,\" Aniston wrote. \"Let's make that decision for ourselves and for the young women in this world who look to us as examples. Let's make that decision consciously, outside of the tabloid noise. We don't need to be married or mothers to be complete. Vance's Viral 'Childless' Comments", "body": "Jennifer Aniston is weighing in after a 2021 interview with J.D. Vance has resurfaced amid his run for the vice presidency.\n\nJennifer Aniston has some strong words for Donald Trump's running mate, J.D. Vance. The 55-year-old actress took to her Instagram Story on Wednesday to slam Vance's recently resurfaced comments about women without children holding positions of power in the government.\n\n\"I truly can't believe this is coming from a potential VP of The United States,\" she wrote, sharing an image of Vance's viral 2021 interview with then-Fox News host Tucker Carlson. \"All I can say is... Mr. Vance, I pray that your daughter is fortunate enough to bear children of her own one day. I hope she will not need to turn to IVF as a second option. Because you are trying to take that away from her, too.\"\n\nAt the time of his interview, Vance spoke out against Vice President Kamala Harris. The 59-year-old highest-ranking female official in U.S. history is now running for president after President Joe Biden announced he would be bowing out of the 2024 presidential race and endorsed her for the Democratic presidential nominee.\n\n\"We're effectively run in this country -- via the democrats, via our corporate oligarchs -- by a bunch of childless cat ladies who are miserable at their own lives and the choices that they've made and so they want to make the rest of the country miserable, too,\" Vance told Carlson in 2021. \"And it's just a basic fact -- you look at Kamala Harris, Pete Buttigieg, AOC [Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez] -- the entire future of the Democrats is controlled by people without children. And how does it make any sense that we've turned our country over to people who don't really have a direct stake in it?\"\n\nHarris has been married to Doug Emhoff since 2014 and is a stepmother to his two children, 29-year-old Cole and 25-year-old Ella.\n\nAniston weighs in after publicly sharing her previous struggles with infertility in a 2022 cover story for Allure magazine.\n\nThe Friends alum opened up in heartbreaking detail about the \"hard s**t\" she went through in her 30s and 40s, revealing, \"I was trying to get pregnant. It was a challenging road for me, the baby-making road.\"\n\nShe added that while the world was speculating, she was trying every means possible to conceive a child.\n\n\"All the years and years and years of speculation... {"uri": "8241574440", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-07-24", "time": "16:01:39", "dateTime": "2024-07-24T16:01:39Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-07-24T15:59:13Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.7411764860153198, "url": "https://ca.news.yahoo.com/j-d-vance-once-called-155327742.html", "title": "J.D. Vance Once Called Kamala Harris a 'Childless Cat Lady.' Now Real-Life 'Cat Ladies' Have Thoughts", "body": "Comments made by the Republican vice presidential nominee in a 2021 interview are resurfacing\n\nComments made by Republican vice presidential nominee J.D. Vance in a 2021 interview are now resurfacing -- and stirring conversation among people who either don't want, or can't have, children.\n\nYears before he was selected as Donald Trump's running mate, Vance gave an interview with then-Fox News host Tucker Carlson in July 2021. During the conversation, Vance said the U.S. was being run, under Democratic leadership, by \"a bunch of childless cat ladies who are miserable at their own lives and the choices that they've made and so they want to make the rest of the country miserable, too. \"\n\n\"It's just a basic fact -- you look at Kamala Harris, Pete Buttigieg, AOC -- the entire future of the Democrats is controlled by people without children,\" Vance, 39, told Carlson. And how does it make any sense that we've turned our country over to people who don't really have a direct stake in it?\"\n\nRelated: J.D. Vance Isn't the Bridge-Building VP That Moderates Wanted: What He's Said About Women, Voting and Project 2025\n\nVance went on to say that those who \"actually have kids\" are \"the people who have a more direct stake in the future of this country.\"\n\nThat Vance, who has three children with wife Usha Chilukuri Vance, called out three \"childless\" Democrats by name is particularly noteworthy -- in part, because it's not true. One of them, Harris, became a stepmom to her husband Doug Emhoff's two children in August 2014. Now the presumptive Democratic nominee for president, Harris has for years spoken openly about her close relationship with her stepchildren, who refer to her as \"Momala.\"\n\nButtigieg, meanwhile, now the Secretary of Transportation, does have children: twins he adopted with husband Chasten in September 2021, just weeks after Vance's interview aired.\n\nNew York Rep. Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez, meanwhile, does not have children. But as critics of Vance's comments have weighed in: so what?\n\nNever miss a story -- sign up for PEOPLE's free daily newsletter to stay up-to-date on the best of what PEOPLE has to offer, from celebrity news to compelling human interest stories.\n\nFlorida state Rep. Anna Eskamani chided Vance for his comments in a post on X, writing, \"As a childless cat lady I have a huge stake in America and am not miserable but thanks for your concern, Vance.\"\n\nFormer Sec. of State Hillary Clinton, who ran for the presidency against Trump in 2016, wrote sarcastically: \"What a normal, relatable guy who certainly doesn't hate women having freedoms,\"\n\nOthers have expressed similar thoughts, questioning why someone without biological children is less invested in the good of the country than someone with children.\n\n\"Calling step-mom Kamala Harris a childless cat lady is going to enrage not just single women but all the parents of step-kids who are having their parenting denigrated,\" one user on X wrote. \" Vance's history of misogyny is just an endless wellspring of hate to highlight.\"\n\nRelated: Kamala Harris on Her Marriage, What Keeps Her Up at Night and the Beyonc\u00e9 Song She Calls Her Anthem (Exclusive)\n\nAnother offered a more sarcastic assessment of the Republican's comments, asking: \"Should really help win over women voters, huh?\"\n\nSpeaking to CNN's Kaitlan Collins this week, Buttigieg noted that the comments directed at him came at a time when he and his husband \"had been through a fairly heartbreaking setback in our adoption journey.\"\n\n\"[Vance] couldn't have known that, but maybe that's why you shouldn't be talking about other people's children,\" Buttigieg added.\n\nAnd many others have seized on a very famous cat-owner without kids -- Taylor Swift, sharing photos of her 2023 TIME Person of the Year (on which she appeared alongside one of her cats) in response to Vance's comments.\n\nAs Guardian columnist Arwa Mahdawi wrote, though, it is possible Vance didn't actually mean what he said back in 2021, especially considering his track record (though now Trump's running mate, he previously called the former president \"America's Hitler\" and called himself \"a never Trump guy.\"\n\nMahdawi cites data that shows that many women who are unmarried and childless aren't unhappy in the slightest -- in fact, the opposite, often ranking higher in terms of health and happiness than those with children.\n\nOthers have simply taken Vance's comments and run with them, espousing Vance's comments as something of a rallying cry. {"uri": "8243493939", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-07-25", "time": "17:49:51", "dateTime": "2024-07-25T17:49:51Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-07-25T17:48:54Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.7372549176216125, "url": "https://globalnews.ca/news/10643392/jennifer-aniston-jd-vance-childless-cat-ladies/", "title": "Jennifer Aniston slams JD Vance's 'childless cat ladies' comments - National | Globalnews.ca", "body": "Jennifer Aniston is taking aim at JD Vance, criticizing him for comments he made in the past about \"childless cat ladies.\"\n\nThe Morning Show star, who has been open about her struggles with fertility, put Donald Trump's vice-presidential candidate in her crosshairs via Instagram after a resurfaced clip showed Vance slamming Democratic politicians who do not have biological children.\n\n\"We're effectively run in this country -- via the Democrats, via our corporate oligarchs -- by a bunch of childless cat ladies who are miserable at their own lives and the choices that they've made, and so they want to make the rest of the country miserable too,\" Vance, then a Senate candidate, told Tucker Carlson on his now-defunct Fox News show in 2021.\n\n\"You look at Kamala Harris, Pete Buttigieg, AOC (Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez): The entire future of the Democrats is controlled by people without children, and how does it make any sense that we've turned our country over to people who don't really have a direct stake in it?\" Vance continued at the time.\n\nOn Wednesday, 55-year-old Aniston took Vance to task for those comments, sharing her thoughts in her Instagram story with her nearly 45 million followers.\n\n\"I truly can't believe this is coming from a potential VP of The United States,\" the Friends star wrote.\n\n\"I pray that your daughter is fortunate enough to bear children of her own one day. I hope she will not need to turn to IVF (in vitro fertilization) as a second option. Because you are trying to take that away from her, too.\"\n\nLast month, Vance, along with other Senate Republicans, voted to block Democrat-proposed legislation to guarantee access to IVF nationwide. And during his Senate bid, he lent his support to the Supreme Court overturning Roe v. Wade and for Texas's ban on abortion.\n\nIn 2022, Aniston shared with Allure magazine that she tried to get pregnant for several years and underwent unsuccessful rounds of IVF.\n\n\"I would've given anything if someone had said to me, 'Freeze your eggs. Do yourself a favour.' You just don't think it. So here I am today,\" she told the magazine, adding that years of speculation from the public and press made it that much more difficult.\n\n\"The ship has sailed.\"\n\nAnd it's not just Aniston who is hitting back at Vance over his past judgments about childless adults - Transportation Secretary Pete Buttigieg, who was criticized by Vance in the clip, addressed the comments earlier this week, speaking about the twins he adopted in 2021 with his husband, Chasten.\n\n\"The really sad thing is he said that after Chasten and I had been through a fairly heartbreaking setback in our adoption journey,\" Buttigieg told CNN's The Source.\n\n\"He couldn't have known that -- but maybe that's why you shouldn't be talking about other people's children.\"\n\nOne of Harris's stepchildren (she has two with husband Doug Emhoff) also blasted Vance on Instagram.\n\n\"How can you be 'childless' when you have cutie pie kids like cole and I?\" Ella Emhoff, 25, wrote on her Instagram story Thursday, referring to her 29-year-old brother, Cole Emhoff.\n\nShe also shared a screenshotted quote from her mother, Kerstin Emhoff, in which she defended Harris against Vance's controversial comments.\n\n\"For over 10 years, since Cole and Ella were teenagers, Kamala has been a co-parent with Doug and I,\" Kerstin told CNN Wednesday, calling the Hillbilly Elegy author's comments \"baseless attacks\" on Harris.\n\n\"She is loving, nurturing, fiercely protective and always present,\" Kerstin continued. \"I love our blended family and am grateful to have her in it.\"", "source": Mr. Vance, I pray that your daughter is fortunate enough to bear children of her own one day,\" Aniston wrote on July 24.\n\nThe Morning Show star and Friends alum continued as follows:\n\n\"I hope she will not need to turn to IVF as a second option. Because you are trying to take that away from her, too.\"\n\nAs you can see above, Aniston included a screenshot of a tweet from Vance's old interview with then-Fox News host Tucker Carlson.\n\nIn the exchange, the 39-year old said this nation was being run by \"a bunch of childless cat ladies who are miserable at their own lives and the choices that they've made and so they want to make the rest of the country miserable, too.\"\n\nVance even went on to cite Harris, Transportation Secretary Pete Buttigieg and Congresswoman Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez... the former of whom is now running for president after Joe Biden withdrew from the 2024 race.\n\n\"It's just a basic fact -- you look at Kamala Harris, Pete Buttigieg, AOC -- the entire future of the Democrats is controlled by people without children,\" Vance told Carlson, adding at the time:\n\n\"And how does it make any sense that we've turned our country over to people who don't really have a direct stake in it?\"\n\nFor the record, Buttigieg is now the father of two-year old twins.\n\nHarris is also the step-mother of husband Doug Emhoff's two biological kids, Ella and Cole.\n\n\"These are baseless attacks,\" Emhoff's' ex-wife said in a statement to CNN this week.\n\n\"For over 10 years, since Cole and Ella were teenagers, Kamala has been a co-parent with Doug and I. We get to decide for ourselves what is beautiful when it comes to our bodies. That decision is ours and ours alone,\" Aniston wrote back then.\n\n\"Let's make that decision for ourselves and for the young women in this world who look to us as examples.\n\n\"Let's make that decision consciously, outside of the tabloid noise.
